Isaac Asimov

  • Sam Mead
  • ·
  • Sep 17, 2015
  • ·
  • Quotes, Isaac Asimov

To succeed, planning alone is insufficient. One must improvise as well.

— Salvor Hardin

From the book Foundation.

Bonus quote! Also from Foundation:

Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.

— Salvor Hardin

Which I particularly love, because it begs the question: “Are morals universal or relative?”.

To which the best answer I have heard so far is:

Morality is simply one man’s way of justifying a personal view of what is right and wrong. It is the rightness or wrongness that is universal and thus transcends morality.

— Simon MacFarlane

Interesting side-story — “Are morals universal or relative?” was one of the original 29 Saberr test questions! I always used to answer ‘universal’, but now I might have to answer differently…
